properties.address: Canklow Pavillion, South Yorkshire S60 2JH
properties.description: RotherFed are offering new community-based drop-in session through the Open Arms Community Support Hubs. A range of local voluntary and community groups, including RotherFed, Citizens Advice Rotherham & District, LASER Credit Union, and Voluntary Action Rotherham, have partnered to develop and deliver a co-ordinated response to support communities most affected by the cost of living crisis. RotherFed’s Community Engagement team and advisers will deliver information, advice and guidance at venues across the borough, right in the heart of the community. Residents will be able to access support with a strong focus on financial and social inclusion, empowering communities with a foundation of support, and making better use of community assets. Each hub will have a drop-in session throughout the day every fortnight. The session at Canklow will run on Wednesdays between 9.30am-3.30pm on a fortnightly basis. The project has been made possible by the UK Shared Prosperity Fund, part of the national government’s Levelling Up agenda, which was successfully secured by Rotherham Council and South Yorkshire Mayoral Combined Authority.
properties.title: Open Arms Community Support Hub - Canklow

properties.description: Charge a device, warm and welcoming, no need to purchase anything, free wifi, refreshments available to purchase

hours._text:
Sunday Services: 11am – 12.30pm 
Coffee Morning: Wed & Fri 10am-12.30pm 
Toddler Group (0-4yrs): Fri 9.15-11.30 (term time only); £1.50, drop in session
Handsworth Foodbank: Tues 12-2pm & Thurs 4-6pm (referrals only)
Knitting Group: Thurs 6.30pm – 8pm: 9:30am-12:30pm, Fri: 9:30am-12:30pm. Toddler Group - Fri (term time only): 9:15am-10:30am, 10:45am-12pm. Knitting Group - Thu: 6:30pm-8pm

properties.title: Grace Church

properties.address: 409 Handsworth Road, S13 9BQ

hours._text: Wednesday: Drop in to speak to TARA - Housing/Police may be present, 11am - 12.30.

properties.title: Handsworth & Ballifield TARA

properties.address: Tannery Close Woodhouse S13 7LA
properties.description: Cafe and craft club (optional) Foodworks Hub
properties.title: Now Church

properties.address: Main Street, Hackenthorpe, Sheffield, S12 4LY
properties.description: Award winning Cafe. Open for everyone Monday - Saturday. Knit and matter Mondays 10.30. Singer, bingo and quiz once a fortnight. Fully accessible, focusing on attracting isolated people and those living with, or affected by dementia.
properties.title: Remember When

properties.address: Richmond Church, 371 Richmond Road, S13 8LT
properties.description: Warm space comfy seats, background music, Hot/Cold drinks and cake (optional donations), opportunity to meet and chat with people from the church and communinty
properties.title: Richmond Church

properties.address: Scowerdons Community Centre, Wickfield Grove, S12 4TL
properties.description: On Mondays we are open for the public to purchase foodworks meals 2-8pm The 3rd Monday of the month we have citizens advuice 2-4pm (this may be changing to fortnightly ) we also run groups in the evening , the next one will be a cooking class starting after May , we are not open as a welcome space as such on a Monday however if someone needs to get warm and a cuppa we wouldn’t turn them away Tuesdays we are open to the public 9.30-12.30 we sell the foodworks meals, we have local councillors , housing officers and other visiting agencies and the dates are posted on the Facebook page . We also run HAF sessions on Thursdays in the school holidays which can be booked through the council website
properties.title: S12 Community Pantry & Social Café

properties.address: First Floor, Shortbrook Primary School Site, Westfield Northway, Sheffield, S20 8FB
properties.description: Sheffield's Family Centres and Early Years Start for Life Services are committed to enabling and supporting expectant parents, babies, children, and their families to have a great start in life by providing services as early as possible.
properties.title: Shortbrook Family Centre

properties.address: 402b Handsworth Road, Handsworth S13 9BZ
properties.description:
Social Café weekly on Tuesdays 10-11.30am. refreshments and bingo/quizzes and occasional speakers.
Craft & Natter weekly on Thursdays 2-4pm. Refreshments.
Lunch Club (55+). Weekly on Thursdays 11.30am to 1.30pm. Meal and bingo.
properties.title: St Mary’s Community Hub

properties.address: 83 Stradbroke Drive, Sheffield
properties.description: Tuesdays coffee morning 10.30 till 11.30, Wednesday Chair aerobics 12.30 – 2pm, Friday Knitting group 10am – 11am
properties.title: The Link Community Hub

properties.address: 120-126 Bawtry Rd, Sheffield, S9 1UE
properties.description: Free access to books, newspapers and magazines Books and reading materials in community languages Free access to computers and the internet

hours._text: Mon: 10am to 12pm & 2pm to 5pm, Tues: Closed, Weds: 10am to 12pm, Thurs: 10am to 12pm, Fri: Closed, Sat: Closed

properties.title: Tinsley Library

properties.address: Westfield Community Centre, 32 Westfield Centre, Westfield, Sheffield, S20 8ND
properties.description: TV/books, Unlimited tea, coffee, juice & water, Warm environment to meet other people, Option of purchasing a frozen meal provided by food works for minimum of £1 donation which can be cooked and eaten there
